meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irreformable.
meanings.sent1: The irreformability of the ancient law made it impossible to update.
meanings.sent2: Her stubbornness and irreformability made it challenging to change her mind.
meanings.sent3: The irreformability of the old computer system was both frustrating and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The irreformability of the mountain stood as a symbol of strength and permanence.
meanings.sent5: The irreformability of the decision left no room for negotiation.

meanings.definition: The inability to be reformed or changed.
meanings.sent1: Despite numerous attempts, the irreformability of the policy remained unchanged.
meanings.sent2: The irreformability of his bad habits made it hard for him to improve.
meanings.sent3: The irreformability of the stubborn old cat was both frustrating and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The irreformability of time marches on, unyielding to our desires.
meanings.sent5: The irreformability of the weather forecast made planning difficult.
